# positionOfToken(at:)

**Instance Method**

Converts a token index into a text position.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func positionOfToken(at tokenIndex: Int) -> UITextPosition
```

## Parameters

- **tokenIndex**: The array index of the token.

## Return Value

The text position of the token.

## Discussion

Use this method to convert a token’s index in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISearchTextField/tokens] array into the token’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextPosition] in the overall contents of the text field. Many [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextInput] methods for interacting with text take a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextPosition] or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextRange] (constructed from two text positions) as a parameter.

To select a search token, assign a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextRange] that contains the token’s position to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITextInput/selectedTextRange] property.

## Customizing token behavior

- **tokenBackgroundColor**: The background color for all tokens in the search text field.
- **tokens(in:)**: Returns the search field’s tokens that are within a given range.
